#Text=The host Charlotte Hornets defeated the visiting Orlando Magic , 120 - 113 , on Sunday afternoon .
#Text=Charlotte ( 3 - 3 ) enjoyed what was easily its best offensive night of the season thus far .
#Text=All-Star point guard Kemba Walker delivered his strongest outing of the new season , leading the team with 34 points and 10 assists .
#Text=Walker 's early production helped the Hornets gain an early double - digit lead in the first quarter , which they were able to maintain to varying degrees for the remainder of the game .
#Text=Despite never fully pulling away , the Hornets played consistently well throughout the game .
#Text=Charlotte dominated Orlando on the glass , finishing with a 59 to 40 rebounding advantage .
#Text=On offense , the team finished shooting over 54 percent from the floor and had all five starters score in double figures , including three who scored at least 20 points .
#Text=Veteran center Dwight Howard entered the game averaging a league - best 18 rebounds per game .
#Text=Though he posted his season low , pulling down only 10 , he was able to earn his sixth consecutive double - double as he scored 22 points .
#Text=Howard and fellow veteran big man Marvin Williams were crucial to the win , as the duo combined for 35 points and 21 rebounds on 15 - of - 21 shooting .
#Text=Orlando ( 4 - 2 ) , meanwhile , entered the matchup atop the Eastern Conference thanks to what has been an unexpectedly successful start to the season .
#Text=The Magic boasted the second - best offensive rating in the league before visiting Charlotte and continued to look strong on offense despite the loss .
#Text=Orlando splashed home 11 three - pointers and knocked down 20 free - throws , excelling at reaching the line throughout the game .
#Text=Breakout stars Evan Fournier and Aaron Gordon , who entered the game averaging over 22 points per game each , impressed once again .
#Text=The duo combined for 40 points , while Gordon blocked two shots and came away with two steals .
#Text=The Magic 's top performer , though , proved to be bench wing Jonathan Simmons .
#Text=Simmons scored a whopping 27 points in just 32 minutes off the bench .
#Text=Thanks to strong play from Simmons and the second unit , Charlotte 's lead was never able to remain safe despite the game 's final outcome .
#Text=The Hornets will visit Memphis on Monday , while the Magic will visit New Orleans .
